name: GetScheduleInfo
description:
Retrieve detailed schedule information from Pagerduty.

This tool retrieves comprehensive information regarding a specific schedule from Pagerduty, including details for each schedule layer. Utilize this tool when you need to access and display schedule information. Requires schedule ID to function.

parameters.name: schedule_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the schedule resource in Pagerduty.

parameters.name: accept_header_versioning
parameters.description: The `Accept` header specifies versioning information for the API request. Use a valid versioning value formatted as a string.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type_header
parameters.description: Specifies the MIME type of the request body. Must be 'application/json' for this endpoint.

parameters.name: time_zone_for_results
parameters.description: Specify the time zone for rendering results. Defaults to the schedule's time zone.

value_schema.description: Time zone in which results will be rendered. This will default to the schedule's time zone.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start date for the schedule entries. Defaults to 2 weeks before 'until' if not provided. This is optional and affects the rendered_schedule_entries fields when include[] for schedule types is used.

value_schema.description: The start of the date range over which you want to show schedule entries. Defaults to 2 weeks before until if an until is given. Optional parameter. When provided with include[] for schedule types, populates the rendered_schedule_entries fields in the response.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end of the date range to show schedule entries. Defaults to 2 weeks after the start date if not provided. Optional.

value_schema.description: The end of the date range over which you want to show schedule entries. Defaults to 2 weeks after since if a since is given. Optional parameter. When provided with include[] for schedule types, populates the rendered_schedule_entries fields in the response.

parameters.name: user_id_for_next_oncall
parameters.description: Specify a user ID to get information about this user's next on-call schedule.

value_schema.description: Specify an `user_id`, and the schedule list API will return information about this user's next on-call.

parameters.name: allow_overflow
parameters.description: Set true to include schedule entries beyond date range bounds.

value_schema.description:
Any on-call schedule entries that pass the date range bounds will be truncated at the bounds, unless the parameter `overflow=true` is passed. This parameter defaults to false.
For instance, if your schedule is a rotation that changes daily at midnight UTC, and your date range is from `2011-06-01T10:00:00Z` to `2011-06-01T14:00:00Z`:


- If you don't pass the `overflow=true` parameter, you will get one schedule entry returned with a start of `2011-06-01T10:00:00Z` and end of `2011-06-01T14:00:00Z`.
- If you do pass the `overflow=true` parameter, you will get one schedule entry returned with a start of `2011-06-01T00:00:00Z` and end of `2011-06-02T00:00:00Z`.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: time_zone
parameters.description: Time zone in which results will be rendered. This will default to the schedule's time zone.

value_schema.description: Time zone in which results will be rendered. This will default to the schedule's time zone.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: The start of the date range over which you want to show schedule entries. Defaults to 2 weeks before until if an until is given. Optional parameter. When provided with include[] for schedule types, populates the rendered_schedule_entries fields in the response.

value_schema.description: The start of the date range over which you want to show schedule entries. Defaults to 2 weeks before until if an until is given. Optional parameter. When provided with include[] for schedule types, populates the rendered_schedule_entries fields in the response.

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: The end of the date range over which you want to show schedule entries. Defaults to 2 weeks after since if a since is given. Optional parameter. When provided with include[] for schedule types, populates the rendered_schedule_entries fields in the response.

value_schema.description: The end of the date range over which you want to show schedule entries. Defaults to 2 weeks after since if a since is given. Optional parameter. When provided with include[] for schedule types, populates the rendered_schedule_entries fields in the response.

parameters.name: overflow
parameters.description:
Any on-call schedule entries that pass the date range bounds will be truncated at the bounds, unless the parameter `overflow=true` is passed. This parameter defaults to false.
For instance, if your schedule is a rotation that changes daily at midnight UTC, and your date range is from `2011-06-01T10:00:00Z` to `2011-06-01T14:00:00Z`:


- If you don't pass the `overflow=true` parameter, you will get one schedule entry returned with a start of `2011-06-01T10:00:00Z` and end of `2011-06-01T14:00:00Z`.
- If you do pass the `overflow=true` parameter, you will get one schedule entry returned with a start of `2011-06-01T00:00:00Z` and end of `2011-06-02T00:00:00Z`.

value_schema.description:
Any on-call schedule entries that pass the date range bounds will be truncated at the bounds, unless the parameter `overflow=true` is passed. This parameter defaults to false.
For instance, if your schedule is a rotation that changes daily at midnight UTC, and your date range is from `2011-06-01T10:00:00Z` to `2011-06-01T14:00:00Z`:


- If you don't pass the `overflow=true` parameter, you will get one schedule entry returned with a start of `2011-06-01T10:00:00Z` and end of `2011-06-01T14:00:00Z`.
- If you do pass the `overflow=true` parameter, you will get one schedule entry returned with a start of `2011-06-01T00:00:00Z` and end of `2011-06-02T00:00:00Z`.

parameters.name: include_next_oncall_for_user
parameters.description: Specify an `user_id`, and the schedule list API will return information about this user's next on-call.

value_schema.description: Specify an `user_id`, and the schedule list API will return information about this user's next on-call.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
